result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with witness A/Sonesta Selects Hotel listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:05 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Samuel O Parks in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Samuel O Parks. 
The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Herbers will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 AM Defendant Samuel O Parks not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a $350.00 arrest warrant and forfeit bail.
